thread.title: Talk Talk says cyberattack data theft not as bad as feared
thread.title_full: Talk Talk says cyberattack data theft not as bad as feared

title: Talk Talk says cyberattack data theft not as bad as feared
text:
Anthony Devlin Talk Talk says cyberattack data theft not as bad as feared 
FILE - In this file photo dated Oct. 3, 2014, Dido Harding, Chief Executive of telecommunications company TalkTalk. Phone and Internet service provider Talk Talk said Friday that private data from its 4 million British customers may have been compromised in a "significant and sustained" cyberattack on its website, and Chief Executive Harding said "there is a risk that all of our customers' personal data has been accessed," including credit card and bank details. (Anthony Devlin / FILE PA via AP) UNITED KINGDOM OUT - NO SALES - NO ARCHIVES Posted: Saturday, October 24, 2015 1:06 pm | Updated: 4:01 pm, Sat Oct 24, 2015. Talk Talk says cyberattack data theft not as bad as feared   
LONDON (AP) — British telecoms company Talk Talk says a cyberattack feared to have put 4 million customers' details at risk is not as bad as initially thought. 
Chief executive Dido Harding said Saturday that attackers hacked the company's website but not its core systems, and "none of our customers' credit card information has been exposed." kAm$96 D2:5 D@>6 32?< 244@F?E 56E2:=D 925 366? 2446DD65[ 3FE ?@E 6?@F89 7@C E9:6G6D E@ DE62= >@?6J 7C@> 4FDE@>6CDV 244@F?ED]k^Am kAm%2=< %2=< 92D 24<?@H=65865 E92E :E C62=:K65 :E H2D F?56C 2EE24< @?
